# orchagent

> AI agent marketplace and runtime. Publish agents, call them via API. BYOK model - you bring your own LLM keys.

## Overview

orchagent is a free marketplace where developers find, run, and share AI agents. The agent marketplace that runs your code securely.

**Key features:**
- Publish agents in minutes (prompt-based or code-based)
- Call any agent via simple API
- Fork and improve others' agents
- Free tier: 1000 calls/day
- BYOK: Bring your own LLM API keys

## Agent Types

**Prompt-based agents:** Provide a prompt template + input/output schema. orchagent handles the LLM call.

**Code-based agents:** Provide Python/JS code that runs on orchagent infrastructure. Full control over logic, external APIs, multi-step workflows.

## Docs

- [Introduction](https://docs.orchagent.io/introduction): What is orchagent
- [Quickstart](https://docs.orchagent.io/quickstart): Get running in 60 seconds
- [API Reference](https://docs.orchagent.io/using-agents/api-reference): Authentication, endpoints, errors
- [CLI Commands](https://docs.orchagent.io/using-agents/cli-commands): orch login, call, run, publish
- [Code Snippets](https://docs.orchagent.io/using-agents/code-snippets): curl, Python, JavaScript, TypeScript examples
- [Agent Types](https://docs.orchagent.io/building-agents/agent-types): Prompt-based vs code-based
- [Manifest Format](https://docs.orchagent.io/building-agents/manifest-format): orchagent.json schema
- [Publishing](https://docs.orchagent.io/building-agents/publishing): Publish your agent
- [Orchestration](https://docs.orchagent.io/building-agents/orchestration): Agent-to-agent calls
- [BYOK](https://docs.orchagent.io/concepts/byok): Bring Your Own Key model
- [Local vs Server](https://docs.orchagent.io/concepts/local-vs-server): orch run vs orch call
- [Rate Limits](https://docs.orchagent.io/concepts/rate-limits): Platform limits

## API

- Base URL: https://api.orchagent.io
- Auth: Bearer token (API key from dashboard)
- OpenAPI spec: https://docs.orchagent.io/api-reference/openapi.json

## Quick Start

### Call an agent (no account needed, runs locally)
```bash
npx orchagent run orchagent/summarizer --input '{"text": "Your text here"}'
```

### Call an agent (server execution, account required)
```bash
npm install -g orchagent
orch login
orch call orchagent/summarizer --data '{"text": "Your text here"}'
```

### API call
```bash
curl -X POST https://api.orchagent.io/acme/summarizer/v1/analyze \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $ORCHAGENT_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"text": "Your text here"}'
```

## Core Concepts

| Term | Definition |
|------|------------|
| Agent | An API endpoint that performs a task using AI |
| Prompt-based agent | Author provides prompt + schema. orchagent handles LLM call. |
| Code-based agent | Author provides code that runs on orchagent infrastructure. |
| Orchestrator | An agent that calls other agents |
| BYOK | Bring Your Own Key - users provide their own LLM API keys |
| Star | Users can star agents they like (like GitHub stars) |
| Fork | Copy an agent to your account and modify it |
| Version | Each publish creates a new version (v1, v2, v3...) |

## Links

- Website: https://orchagent.io
- Dashboard: https://orchagent.io/dashboard
- API: https://api.orchagent.io
- Docs: https://docs.orchagent.io
